intro: Mesembryanthemum grandiflorum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Its fleshy, water-storing leaves help it survive in arid environments. Mesembryanthemum grandiflorum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
